title: Bacterial transporter gene boundary detector
description: This feature detects intergenic boundaries adjacent to transport-related genes in bacterial genomes. It activates with sharp, distinct spikes precisely at the transition points between transport-related genes (ABC transporters, permeases, efflux pumps) and neighboring genes. The feature doesn't activate within coding sequences but specifically at gene junctions, suggesting it may capture conserved intergenic regulatory elements, promoter regions, or sequence motifs that define functional boundaries. The pattern is highly consistent across diverse bacterial phyla including Proteobacteria (alpha, beta) and Gram-positive bacteria, indicating an evolutionarily conserved genomic signature associated with transport gene organization.
